entry.content:

Both regression task and progression task are failing due to bad build errors.
The regression task issue could be a dupe of crbug.com/333014970. The progression task issue - who knows?
Paul, as the weekly triager, can you take a look?

entry.title: Chrome Allow list won't allow Cloudflare ZTNA client (WARP).
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create a (free) Cloudflare Access account. Chose a login method (i.e. One-time PIN, or any SSO) 2. Block * in Chrome. Allow cloudflareaccess.com and com.cloudflare.warp://* 3. Download the Windows ZTNA Warp Client 4. Open the Warp client in the system tray, Preferences, click "Login with Cloudflare Zero Trust". This opens a webpage ([companyname]cloudflareaccess.com) 5. Login using chosen method from step 1, on successful login the browser will attempt to communicate back to ZTNA using the format com.cloudflare.warp://[companyname].cloudflareaccess.com/auth?token=(token) which fails.
# Problem Description Chrome will not accept "com.cloudflare.warp://*" as an allowed protocol in the same way https://* or file://* is allowed. Google support tell me that this is because Chrome sees it as a URL rather than something that needs to be passed to an application.
This makes it impossible to implement both a Chrome block list and Cloudflare ZTNA as the login token is never passed over with this configuration.
# Summary Chrome Allow list won't allow Cloudflare ZTNA client (WARP).
# Additional Data Category: Enterprise \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Migrate WebAppIntegrationTests off of SyncTest infrastructure
entry.content: Change actions to support modifying the sync server instead of a totally different client. Then update CUJs to model them in this way instead of switching profiles and back etc.

entry.title: See if using lower api level for DEX improves start-up
entry.content:
bug 333278162 revealed an ART bug in pre-S where higher api levels (like the one chrome uses) lead to slower DEX verification.
We should see if using a lower value leads to faster start-up.

entry.title: FedCM API: The Login Status API Set-Login header in a Disconnect Endpoint Response does not work
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. As an IdP, Implement the FedCM API Disconnect Endpoint 2. Try to return a "Set-Login" header in the response from the IdP
# Problem Description This issue was brought up in the FedCM repository: https://github.com/fedidcg/FedCM/issues/558 Description of the problem copy-pasted from the above issue:
In the Keycloak implementation of FedCM API [1] we would like to use the disconnect endpoint [2] to perform an actual SSO logout and leverage the Login Status API. Which also means updating the user agent's Login Status Map. The easiest and most convenient way is with the HTTP header in a response from this endpoint.
According to the Login Status API specification [3] you can set the value of the login status with JavScript or an HTTP header. However when I try to return the "Set-Login: logged-out" header in a response from the disconnect endpoint Chrome does not seem to recognize it and does not properly update the Login Status Map.
Here is a code snippet of the return statement in my Disconnect Endpoint implemented with JAX-RS:
return Response.ok(id) .header("Access-Control-Allow-Origin", client_origin) .header("Access-Control-Allow-Credentials", true) .header("Access-Control-Allow-Headers", "Content-Type, Set-Login") .header("Set-Login", "logged-out") .type(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON) .build();
After the user tries to login with IdP via FedCM again, the expected output is "Not signed in with the identity provider." but instead an empty list returns from the accounts list endpoint. I would guess this is a problem with the "cors" mode response which I am not very familiar with.
There can be made some workarounds to update the map, but it just seems unnecessary.
[1] https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/issues/16834 [2] https://fedidcg.github.io/FedCM/#idp-api-disconnect-endpoint [3] https://fedidcg.github.io/FedCM/#browser-api-login-status
# Additional Comments AFAIK implementation of the FedCM API at least to this extend is only in Chrome
# Summary FedCM API: The Login Status API Set-Login header in a Disconnect Endpoint Response does not work
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: No

entry.title: Remove deprecated triggers of NoStatePrefetch
entry.content:
I removed NoStatePrefetchManager::AddIsolatedPrerender() in: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5456311
I think we can remove more triggers that are already deprecated / unused.

entry.title: C/C++ DevTools plugin: support type externref
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create the following files (also attached):
`example.c` ```C __attribute__((export_name("f"))) __externref_t f (__externref_t x, __externref_t y) { return x; } ``` `run.js` ```javascript async function f() { const code = fetch('example.wasm'); const wasmModule = await WebAssembly.instantiateStreaming(code); wasmModule.instance.exports.f({x:1,y:"titi"}, "test"); } f() ``` `index.html` ```html <script src="run.js"></script> ```
2. Compile the `.c` file into wasm:
```bash $ clang-17 -g -Wl,--no-entry --no-standard-libraries --target=wasm32 -mreference-types -o example.wasm example.c ```
3. Install the DevTools Plugin for debugging C/C++ WebAssembly applications
3. Load `index.html` with a local HTTP server.
4. Place a breakpoint into the body of the C function `f` and reload the page.
5. Observe that the reported values for variables `x` and `y` are both `undefined`.
# Problem Description LLVM 17 has added support for type `externref`. This is currently not supported by the C/C++ plugin: the values of variables of this type is not displayed.
# Summary C/C++ DevTools plugin: support type externref
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Refactor: Consider moving ResetPaintsIfNeeded to called when SetIsTrackingSoftNavigationHeuristicsOnDocument is set?
entry.content:
[See this comment](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5311372/comment/2adf8b51_4a7a6ccc/) for more context.
It looks like ResetPaintsIfNeeded is called very eagerly, in SoftNavigationHeuristics::CreateEventScope right after a new context is created, but before the first Task is created (which is when we finally set SetIsTrackingSoftNavigationHeuristicsOnDocument). This seems to be working fine, and the gap in time is probably tiny in most cases, however:
1. If it were ever to happen that a paint is recorded before in this gap, we might break SNH class expectations. Given that Event Dispatch can skil task creation (when there are no registered listeners?), and that some default UA actions can create paintable effects... I am not sure if it's guaranteed to never see paints in this time range.
2. If we were to ever change SNH to be a bit more lazy about starting tracking & resetting paints... for example, if we wanted to support Hover events for task attribution but without resetting paint tracking, then we would want to make the decision about resetting elsewhere.
3. Just generally it seems like SoftNavigationHeuristics::CreateEventScope has a simple and specific job and this is beyond that scope.

entry.title: Remove onload/task delay for multi IDP
entry.content: The current multi IDP behavior still uses onload or a task posting to delay the FedCM flow, but for the OT we do not need to wait since we will only support a single get() call, and we can remove the code since we have gathered enough metrics.

After enabling cross-origin isolation headers on our web-page(COOP & COEP), the google sign-in option does not appear. 3.
# Problem Description The google one-tap sign-in option does not appear in web pages with cross-origin isolation enabled.
# Summary Google one-tap sign-in does not handle the case of cross-origin isolation
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Input of type number is incrementing/decrementing value when user is scrolling
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Have a input of type number 2. Attach a 'wheel' event to input element. 3. Now when the focus is in input element and user is scrolling the page, both input value is changing and also page is scrolling 4. But the catch here is, the issue is reproduced, if the wheel event is not directly attached to input element and attached to any ancestor element also.
# Problem Description I have reproduced the issue in a lit playground https://lit.dev/playground/#project=W3sibmFtZSI6ImluZGV4Lmh0bWwiLCJjb250ZW50IjoiPCFET0NUWVBFIGh0bWw-XG48aGVhZD5cbiAgPHNjcmlwdD5jb25zb2xlLmNsZWFyKCk7PC9zY3JpcHQ--XG48L2hlYWQ-XG48Ym9keT5cbiAgPGRpdiBjbGFzcz1cImNvbnRyb2xzXCI-XG4gICAgPGJ1dHRvbiBpZD1cIndoZWVsQnV0dG9uXCI-QWRkIFdoZWVsPC9idXR0b24-XG4gIDwvZGl2PlxuICA8Zm9ybT5cbiAgICA8ZGl2PlxuICAgICAgPGlucHV0IHR5cGU9XCJudW1iZXJcIiB2YWx1ZT0wPlxuICAgIDwvZGl2PlxuICA8L2Zvcm0-XG4gIDxzY3JpcHQ-
When we click on Add Wheel button, issue can be reproduced. This can be reproduced in react-mui also https://mui.com/joy-ui/react-input/#inner-html-input here , the wheel event is coming from ancestor element.
# Summary Input of type number is incrementing/decrementing value when user is scrolling
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>INPUT
#### Does this feature work correctly in other browsers? No - I can reproduce the problem in another browser
#### Details of interop issue undefined
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: No

entry.title: Why is the scrollbar so ugly, what is the reason behind this design choice
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Go to a website that has scrollable content and doesn't style the scrollbar with CSS 2. Observe the atrocious scrollbar design
# Problem Description I'm really curious, despite many people complaining and I think we can all agree that the chrome scrollbar looks terribly outdated for 2024 why are you choosing to keep this design and not do something more modern like for e.g. Firefox does?
I make websites and I would like to be able to rely on the browser default components looking okay without having to customize such things a ton.
Here are screenshots and my question in the community: https://support.google.com/chrome/thread/269613337/why-is-the-chrome-scrollbar-still-so-ugly
# Summary Why is the scrollbar so ugly, what is the reason behind this design choice
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: No

It's especially helpful if you can capture a bug report right after you experience the bug, and attach it here. See https://developer.android.com/studio/debug/bug-report for instructions.
Screen recordings can also be very helpful - see https://developer.android.com/studio/command-line/adb#screenrecord. Please enable "Show taps" in developer settings.

entry.title: Ephemeral side panel toolbar button not hiding after deregister
entry.content:
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) On ntp open customize chrome side panel (2) In the same tab navigate to a different site
What is the expected result? Side panel closes and ephemeral button in toolbar disappears
What happens instead? Side panel closes but ephemeral button in toolbar remains there.

entry.title: Provide include-cleaner in the Chromium toolchain
entry.content:
WebRTC has been using IWYU sporadically to clean up includes in its codebase (script: tools_webrtc/iwyu/apply-iwyu) Now IWYU doesn't really work any more, and we should switch to include_cleaner from the clang toolset.
However, this is not part of the chromium build toolchain. Using other versions (such as g3's version or the version in clang-tools-17) gives error messages due to version skew.
Would it be possible to compile and distribute a version as part of Chromium's build tool set?

entry.title: [Chrome Perf Accessibility Sheriff]: 2 regressions in blink_perf.accessibility
entry.content:

entry.title: Font conversion
entry.content: Faced issue with conversion of "Avenir Book" font into PDF. Font is substituted/rendered as "Arial" instead of "Avenir Book". Same issue on any version of Chromium. Competitors makes it correct (see attached file).

entry.title: Tabs are getting congested after ungroup tabgroup
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 125.0.6422.0 (Official Build) canary (x86_64) 6587a06b3703f8c7ac270c7c7f3efcd395860bfa-refs/branch-heads/6422@{#1}
OS : Mac Arm (14.3 beta, 13.5 Beta, 11.4,13.4), Mac Intel(10.15.7)
** Prerequisites (flags on/off) - None
Steps to reproduce :
Launch chrome and open NTP Open 2-3 websites (ex: amazon,flipkart,youtube) Right click on any tab and create one tab group Right click on other tabs and add those tabs in that group by selecting add tab to group option Click on that tab group and collapse the tab Once tabs are in collapse.. Right click on the tab group and ungroup
Observed results: Tabs are congested
Expected Result : Tab should not congested
Number of times you were able to reproduce: 5/5 - Yes Bug reproducible after clean install: Yes/No - Yes Bug reproducible after clearing cache and cookies: Yes/No - Yes Bug reproducible on Arm64 Macs: Yes/No - Yes Bug reproducible on Intel Macs: Yes/No - Yes Bug reproducible on Chrome for Windows or Linux: No Bug reproducible on Safari/Firefox (When the issue is in Web Content): Firefox: No Bug reproducible on current stable build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes Chrome Version : Stable #122.0.6261.112 Mac OS : Mac(14.3 Beta,13.5 Beta, 10.15.7, 11.4) Bug reproducible on the current beta channel build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes Chrome Version : Beta #123.0.6312.28 Mac OS : Mac(14.3 Beta,13.5 Beta, 10.15.7, 11.4) Bug reproducible on the current Dev channel build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes Chrome Version : Dev #124.0.6329.0 Mac OS : Mac(14.3 Beta,13.5 Beta, 10.15.7, 11.4) Bug reproducible on the current Canary channel build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes Chrome Version : Canary #124.0.6355.0 Mac OS :Mac(14.3 Beta,13.5 Beta, 10.15.7, 11.4)
This Issue is exists from M-113 onwards. So Raising it as a NR Issue.
Hence this is Non-Regression Issue, Making the Status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Actual Result : https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PW3Vqi-swhU5Rc9kjBLCUxULP1ZQjs13/view?usp=sharing
Note: 1. Issue able to repro on latest Canary #125.0.6422.0 ,Dev #125.0.6396.3, Beta #124.0.6367.60, and Stable #123.0.6312.124 2. Issue not repro on Win(10,11) and Linux
Thank You..!!

entry.title: Add [Measure] or [MeasureAs] to Android Media Integrity API
entry.content:
The new Android WebView Media Integrity API does not have a usage counter as per https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/third_party/+/HEAD/blink/renderer/bindings/IDLExtendedAttributes.md#measure
Add one.

entry.title: base::features::Init not invoked in child processes
entry.content:
The behavior of base feature initialization changed with https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/commit/5e9ab02b335aa84e468f0b23d5c9f9f56cd694bb
Expected behavior: `base::features::Init` is called on all processes. This is important because the function initializes file-scope variables and one copy of those lives in each process.
Actual behavior: The function is only called in the Browser process.
This can be validated by adding a `base::debug::Stacktrace::Print()` in `base::Features::Init()` and starting Chrome. There will be only one print of the function.
It's probably desirable for a fix for this to be merged into m125 to avoid some perceived regressions in hold-back experiments.

entry.title: Ctrl+V not working properly on Android devices
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Connect a keyboard to Android device. Both bluetooth keyboard and otg+wired keyboard are OK. 2. Open a webpage that has textarea on it. For example, https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/textarea 3. Touch or click the textarea to focus on it 4. ### For the following steps, do not use mouse or touchscreen, use only keyboard ### 5. Hold `Shift`, use `arrow keys` to select some text. `Ctrl+C` to copy, use arrow keys to move cursor, then `Ctrl+V` to paste it. This time *maybe* it works. 6. Do step 5 again. Hold `Shift`, use `arrow keys` to select some text. `Ctrl+C` to copy, use arrow keys to move cursor, then `Ctrl+V` to paste it. At this time, `Ctrl+V` NOT WORKING. But if you input some text or touch the textarea, then `Ctrl+V` works.
# Problem Description After copying some text with keyboard only, `Ctrl+V` not working.
Tested with my Android Phone (Redmi K60 Pro, MIUI 14.0.25, Android 13), and Android Tablet (MiPad 5Pro, MIUI 13, Android 11). Both Chrome (v123.0.6312.118, just installed from google play) and Edge has this problem. While Firefox do not. So I think maybe it is a bug of chromium.
# Summary Ctrl+V not working properly on Android devices
# Custom Questions #### Does the problem occur on multiple sites? Yes - Please describe below
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chromium problem
# Additional Data Category: Content \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: VT (0x0b) stripped from XFO/CSP even though only HTTP-/ascii-whitespace should be stripped
entry.content:
Vertical Tabs (0x0b) are interpreted as whitespace for both XFO and CSP even though the specification require ascii-whitespace [CSP](https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-csp/#framework-infrastructure) or HTTP whitespace [XFO](https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#http-whitespace) that both do not contain VT.
- Example 1: `CSP: \vframe-ancestors 'none'` [URL](http://sub.headers.websec.saarland/_hp/tests/framing.sub.html?resp_type=parsing&browser_id=1&label=CSP-FA&first_id=6265&last_id=6269&scheme=http&t_resp_id=6269&t_element_relation=iframe_direct&t_resp_origin=https://headers.webappsec.eu) - Example 2: `CSP: img-src\v 'self'`[URL](http://sub.headers.websec.saarland/_hp/tests/subresource-loading-csp.sub.html?resp_type=parsing&browser_id=1&label=CSP-IMG&first_id=29354&last_id=29358&scheme=http&t_resp_id=29354&t_element_relation=iframe_direct&t_resp_origin=https://headers.webappsec.eu) - Example 3: `XFO: DENY\v`[URL](http://sub.headers.websec.saarland/_hp/tests/framing.sub.html?resp_type=parsing&browser_id=1&label=XFO&first_id=3630&last_id=3634&scheme=http&t_resp_id=3633&t_element_relation=iframe_direct&t_resp_origin=https://headers.webappsec.eu)
Safari has the same issue. Firefox does not strip \v and interprets all these examples as invalid.
Probably related: https://issues.chromium.org/issues/334755563
